text: Edner Brutus (1911-1980) was a Haitian politician, diplomat, and historian. He served as Foreign Minister of Haiti from 1974 to 1978, and as a historian he is best known for his book Révolution dans Saint-Domingue (1969). His father, Timoléon C. Brutus, was also a prominent politician and historian. ==See also== *Liévano–Brutus treaty ==References== * Category:Haitian diplomats Category:Haitian historians Category:Haitian male writers Category:Foreign Ministers of Haiti Category:1911 births Category:1980 deaths Category:20th- century historians
title: Edner Brutus
